intro: Disperis tomaszii, commonly known as the Tomaszowicz disperis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, often with a faintly colored lip. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
